title: How to Delete Recent Documents in Microsoft Word or Excel

steps.title: Open Microsoft Word or Excel.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Word or Excel . If you already have a file open, click File in the top-left corner to navigate to the home page. If you want to remove an individual file from the Recent list, right-click the file in the list and select Remove from list . steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . This is at the bottom-left corner. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . You can find this tab in the left panel.

steps.title: Scroll down to "Display".
steps.content: Scroll down to "Display". This section is about halfway down the page; you'll need to scroll down to see it.

steps.title: Set the number of Recent documents to "0".
steps.content: Set the number of Recent documents to "0". This is the first option underneath the Display header: Show this number of Recent Documents . You can use the down-arrow to change the number, or you can delete the current number and manually enter "0".

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This is at the bottom-right corner. Your changes will be saved. When you click File to go to the home page again, you'll no longer see any documents in the Recent section. If you still see documents, restart Microsoft Word/Excel fully.
